reasoning: Severe chronic neutropenia (SCN) is a rare condition with incidence ~0.15 per 100k (1-2 per million) and prevalence ~2.5 per 100k. Reporting both metrics as it has established incidence and prevalence data. Confidence moderate due to relative rarity and limited large-scale epidemiological studies.
source: Skokowa G et al. (2018). Severe congenital neutropenia: inheritance, induction, and patient management. Front Immunol. 9:1089
